newsitem.title: TURKEY: TURKISH SHARES DIVE 2.2 PCT IN MAJOR PROFIT-TAKING.
newsitem.headline: TURKISH SHARES DIVE 2.2 PCT IN MAJOR PROFIT-TAKING.

text.p: Istanbul shares fell sharply in consolidation on Tuesday after the recent sharp gains, but recovered slightly on fresh support, brokers said.
The IMKB-100 .ISEC ended at 81,504.41, down 1,796.55 points, or 2.16 percent from Monday's all-time high close of 83,300.96. It brushed a low of 81,160 before rebounding on late reaction buys.
Trade volume plunged to 17.30 trillion lira from Monday's record high 28.83 trillion lira.

"Today's profit-taking was a normal technical development which may continue tomorrow. If the index falls through 81,500 it may touch 78,000 levels before turning up again," said Murat Emrali from Eczacibasi securities.
"Sales accelerated in the afternoon which may create downward pressure at the opening tomorrow," he added.
Brokers expect selective demand to be fuelled by nine-month profit prospects. Companies have to announce their nine-month financial statements by October 25 the latest and banks by November 8.
The index had surged 28.6 percent from September 13 to Monday, breaking nine record closes in the strong medium-term uptrend which began with the breaching of 65,000 barrier.

Of the 226 shares traded, losers outdid gainers by 150 to 45 and 31 ended steady. The 85-share industrial index .ISEI fell 2.2 percent to 85,864.51 while the 15-share financial index .ISEF dropped 2.06 percent to 79,386.59.
Actives were led by utilities -- Aktas Elektrik, steady at 81,000 lira, Cukurova Elektrik, down 2,000 lira at 73,000 and its associate Kepez Elektrik, down 3,000 lira at 89,000.
